title: Bug 7734: System can be shut down without save file warnings
description: When the system is shut down, there are no warnings or prompts to save unsaved files.
OB: When I shut down the system, there are no warnings or prompts to save my unsaved files.
EB: When I shut down the system, a dialog box should appear asking if I want to save my files. The options in the dialog box should be Yes, No, and Cancel. Choosing Cancel should halt the shutdown.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Open any application.
2. Create a new document or make changes to an existing document.
3. Try to shut down the system.

Expected behavior:
A dialog box should appear, asking if you want to save your files. Choose an appropriate option and verify that the shutdown proceeds accordingly.
